channel.title: The Dividing Line
channel.description:
Listen to "The Dividing Line", featuring Dr. James White most Tuesday Mornings at 11:00am MST and most Thursday afternoons at 4:00 MST. (pre-feeds begin 30 minutes or so before start of program)
Dr. White welcomes your calls at: (602) 973-4602 (Metro Phoenix) 1-877-753-3341 (Toll Free)
channel.generator: PodAdmin - The Free Web-based Podcast Management Software http://podadmin.sourceforge.net

item.title: June 10, 2014
item.description: James starts off with some commentary about a recent MDI article and then reviews portions of the debate between Sye Ten Bruggencate and Matt Dillahunty. At the end he touches on some comments from molinist Max Andrews.

item.title: June 12, 2014
item.description: James reviews the 'tulip, rose and the poinsettia' in a very unusual show.

item.title: June 17, 2014
item.description: James responds to a pro homosexual video put out by students at Grand Canyon University for the first hour and then a 'dear John' letter by Zach Hunt about John Calvin.

item.title: June 19, 2014
item.description: James begins discussing the current ISIS crisis in Iraq and asks why there is no outcry from the moderate Muslim community about the sheer brutality of this group. Then its on to some comments by 'First Things' discussing 'reasons' why protestants convert

item.title: June 24, 2014
item.description: Open Theism debate announcement with some clips from Bob Enyart who argues that 'God can change the future and write a new song.' Next a follow up to the movie of homosexual students at Grand Canyon. Finally a follow up to the Nick Peters artcle that we r

item.title: June 25, 2014
item.description: While we waited for William to call James reviewed more from the 'Dawa Made Easy' video that he played at the end of yesterday's show. Unfortunately, William did not call.

item.title: July 1, 2014
item.description: John Samson picks up on his TULIP lessons from this past February as he focuses on Irresistable Grace.

item.title: July 3, 2014
item.description: John Samson sits in again and picks up where he left off on Tuesday with Preservation of the Saints.

item.title: July 11, 2014
item.description: James gives a current events update and then moves on to review his recent debate with Bob Enyart and then responds to comments made on Bob's show the day after.

item.title: July 16, 2014
item.description: James returns from his trip to Colorado with a review of the trip, current events and then takes calls. He even gets a call from Manuel Culwell which turns out pretty well.

item.title: July 17, 2014
item.description: James starts with an update on the ongoing Ergun Caner saga and then opens the phones for more calls.

item.title: July 22, 2014
item.description: James brings his 'Mega' game today as he addresses issues with Ergun Caner, Walid Shoebat, Bob Enyart and more.

item.title: July 24, 2014
item.description: James starts off with a graphic comparing Calvinisim to SBC Traditionalism. Then reviews an article by Cheryl Schatz on John 6. Finally its more from the Bob Enyart show.

item.title: July 29, 2014
item.description: Alot of ground to cover today. Ergun Caner preaches at Woodstock, then David Allen's article on Calvinism, more from Bob Enyart etc.

item.title: July 31, 2014
item.description: Responding to David Allen's assertion that 1 Cor 15:3 teaches unlimited atonement, James takes a look at the passage and breaks it down. Then Allen Michael Rea explains his departure from Calvinism and James reviews his claims. Finally more from Bob Enyar

item.title: August 5, 2014
item.description: A review of Don Johnson's book, 'And the Petals Fall' then on to Open Phones.

item.title: August 7, 2014
item.description: James plays some of the most outrageous clips from Theodore Shoebat and responds.

item.title: August 12, 2014
item.description: James starts off with a reminder of what the gospel is and is not. Then more review of Walid Shoebat and militant christian defense. Finishing up with a review of Tim Guthrie's amazing article that paints James as some sort of evil genius.

item.title: August 14, 2014
item.description: James interviews pastor Rudolph Boshoff from South Africa today about the importance of James' upcoming visit there. Then James responds to Steven Anderson's comments on their two and a half hour exchange.

item.title: August 19, 2014
item.description: James begins by commenting on a video discussion involving Vicky Beeching and her 'coming out.' Then he plays a clip from a Sudanese Muslim Cleric that will make your skin crawl. Finally a clip from Ahmed Deedat that will begin a new series.
